TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit WebBrowserPermission extends System.Security.CodeAccessPermission implements class System.Security.Permissions.IUnrestrictedPermission

Docs.summary: The WebBrowserPermission object controls the ability to create the WebBrowser control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF), the Web browser control enables frames to navigate HTML. This permission uses the values of the WebBrowserPermission enumerations.
## XAML Attribute Usage This class is not typically used in XAML.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks By default, the value of the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.WebBrowserPermission.Level%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Security.Permissions.WebBrowserPermissionLevel>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState state) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by specifying a permission state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If `state` is set to <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState>, the value of the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.WebBrowserPermission.Level%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Security.Permissions.WebBrowserPermissionLevel>. If `state` is set to <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState>, the value of the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.WebBrowserPermission.Level%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Security.Permissions.WebBrowserPermissionLevel>.
## Examples The following code example shows how to create a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.WebBrowserPermission> with a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> value.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.IPermission Copy() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates and returns an identical copy of the current permission.
Docs.returns: A copy of the current permission.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A copy of a permission represents the same access to resources as the original permission.
## XAML Attribute Usage Members of this class are either not typically used in XAML, or cannot be used in XAML.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.IPermission Intersect(class System.Security.IPermission target) cil managed

Docs.param: A permission to intersect with the current permission. It must be of the same type as the current permission.
Docs.summary: Creates and returns a permission that is the intersection of the current permission and the specified permission.
Docs.returns: The intersection of two permissions is a permission that describes the state that they both describe in common. Only a demand that passes both original permissions will be valid for the intersected permission.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
## XAML Attribute Usage Members of this class are either not typically used in XAML, or cannot be used in XAML.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool IsSubsetOf(class System.Security.IPermission target) cil managed

Docs.param: A permission that is to be tested for the subset relationship. This permission must be of the same type as the current permission.
Docs.summary: Determines whether the current permission is a subset of the specified permission.
Docs.returns: if the current permission is a subset of the specified permission; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The current permission is a subset of the specified permission if the current permission specifies a set of operations that is wholly contained by the specified permission. For example, a permission that represents access to C:\example.txt is a subset of a permission that represents access to C:\\.
If this method returns `true`, the current permission represents no more access to the protected resource than does the specified permission.
## XAML Attribute Usage Members of this class are either not typically used in XAML, or cannot be used in XAML.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool IsUnrestricted() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a value indicating whether the current permission is unrestricted.
Docs.returns: if the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.WebBrowserPermission.Level%2A> property is set to ; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks An unrestricted permission represents access to any and all resources protected by the permission.
## XAML Attribute Usage Members of this class are either not typically used in XAML, or cannot be used in XAML.
